items.text: On this day in 2010, a magnitude-7.0 earthquake devastated Haiti, especially Port-au-Prince, killing more than 200,000 people and leaving more than 1,000,000 homeless and touching off a massive international relief effort
The U.S. space probe Deep Impact was launched, and in July it shot a 370-kg (810-pound) mass into the nucleus of the comet Tempel 1 in order to study its cometary structure

The groundbreaking television series All in the Family debuted on CBS; the sitcom became known for its frank and satirical treatment of sensitive or important topics.Read our list of the 10 best American sitcoms
American football quarterback Joe Namath led the New York Jets to a surprise 16-7 victory over the heavily favored Baltimore Colts in Super Bowl III in 1969.

The live-action TV series Batman premiered on ABC; a huge hit, it starred Adam West as the Caped Crusader and Burt Ward as Robin.How much do you know about superheroes?Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
American entrepreneur Jeff Bezos was born in 1964. He would go on to found Amazon.com, which played a key role in the growth of e-commerce.
American radio personality and author Rush Limbaugh, who was known for his conservative and often controversial opinions, was born
Hattie Ophelia Caraway became the first woman elected to the U.S. Senate
P.W. Botha, prime minister (1978–84) and president (1984–89) of South Africa, was born
The Anglo-Zulu War began this week as the British sought control over Zululand in eastern South Africa. Name the African battle in our quiz Encyclopædia Britannica, Inc
Jack London, the American novelist known for his works The Call of the Wild (1903) and White Fang (1906), was born in San Francisco in 1876.
The oldest public museum in the United States was established in colonial Charleston, South Carolina
Brooke Foss Westcott — British bishop and scholar
Caroline Maria Seymour Severance — American social reformer
Charles Emmanuel I — duke of Savoy
Edmund Burke — British philosopher and statesman
Eugen Dühring — German philosopher and economist
Adhemar Ferreira da Silva — Brazilian athlete
Alfred Theophil Holder — Austrian language scholar
Charles B. Huggins — American surgeon and medical researcher
Ellen Arthur — wife of Chester Arthur
Georg Forster — German explorer and scientist
